intro: Echinospermum redowskii var. oligacanthum, commonly known as the narrow-bract echinospermum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, bract-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a capitulum. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to its native habitat, with features that aid in water conservation and pollination.
